oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Eads Rosenwald School: view from the road
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Color photograph of one section of a one-story brick school complex. The main building features a cross hipped roof and multiple casement windows. Two entrances are visible with one being on the main building and the other on an extension with a set of stairs leading up to the white doors. Both entrances are covered by flat porch roofs.

The Eads School was built with support of the Julius Rosenwald fund. Further additions were made later, most of which were completed in 1953. The elementary school was used as a clinic for a short period of time, but it was later completely abandoned. In 2015, the building was scheduled for demolition.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Julius Rosenwald Fund -- Buildings; African American schools -- Tennessee
